intro: Boerlagiodendron pachycephalum, commonly known as the thick-headed tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its distinctive, thickened, woody stems that are often covered in a dense layer of bark. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
